docs.snippet: Unbundling sounds promising, but more choice and the possibility of paying less do not necessarily translate into consumer satisfaction....
docs.lead_paragraph: Unbundling sounds promising, but more choice and the possibility of paying less do not necessarily translate into consumer satisfaction.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; emergence of stand-alone streaming services and increasing regulatory pressure may one day force cable companies to unbundle their television packages, freeing consumers to pay for only those channels they enjoy; data suggests that shift could nonetheless reduce customer satisfaction, as was case with a la carte pricing in the airline industry.

headline.main: What Rising Airline Fees Tell Us About the Cable Industry
headline.print_headline: If Cable TV Charged Like the Airlines

docs.snippet: It is only merciful to give The Times’s Knicks beat writer, Scott Cacciola, a break from such a woeful team. But where should he be sent to write about good hoops?...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is only merciful to give The Times’s Knicks beat writer, Scott Cacciola, a break from such a woeful team. But where should he be sent to write about good hoops?
docs.abstract: Satirical note from New York Times sports editors informs readers that reporter Scott Cacciola will be given break from covering the New York Knicks due to their abysmal performance; solicits suggestions for what teams Cacciola should cover instead.

headline.main: Wanted: Better Basketball for a Beleaguered Reporter

docs.snippet: Players’ families will be reimbursed for some travel expenses for the College Football Playoff’s title game and the men’s and women’s basketball Final Fours, the N.C.A.A. said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Players’ families will be reimbursed for some travel expenses for the College Football Playoff’s title game and the men’s and women’s basketball Final Fours, the N.C.A.A. said.
docs.abstract: NCAA grants waiver allowing College Football Playoff to reimburse players' parents or legal guardians for travel, hotels and meals when traveling to championship game between Ohio State and Oregon; pilot program will also extend to semifinals and finals of the NCAA college basketball tournament; decision closely follows complaint issued by Ohio State coach Urban Meyer.

docs.snippet: Bud Selig, the ninth commissioner of Major League Baseball, retires later this month. He’s had many hits in his 22-year tenure: record revenues (nearly $9 billion this past season, up from $1.2 billion when he assumed office), record attenda...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bud Selig, the ninth commissioner of Major League Baseball, retires later this month. He’s had many hits in his 22-year tenure: record revenues (nearly $9 billion this past season, up from $1.2 billion when he assumed office), record attendance at a score of new ballparks; and no strikes or lockouts in two decades. He’s had a few misses as well: the Steroids Era; the cancellation of the 1994 World Series, a tie in the 2002 All-Star Game; and an overall image that, however unfair, typically includes the modifier “bumbling” rather than “beloved.”

headline.main: Exclusive: Bud Selig: The Baseball Commissioner's Exit Interview
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Bud Selig: The Baseball Commissioner's Exit Interview
